paragraphs: The annual pumpkin exhibition will take place at the Prague Botanical Garden. This time it will be called "Spooky Forest" (Strašidelný les) and will be decorated in a Halloween style.
From October 10 to November 2, visitors will be able to see dozens of different varieties of pumpkins, zucchinis, and pattypan squashes with a total weight of over 5 tons.
They will be assembled and painted into whimsical decorations in the form of skeletons, ghosts, witches, and other creepy creatures.
As part of the exhibition, workshops for children on creating various figures and decorations from pumpkins will be held every weekend.
In addition, the little ones, together with their parents, will be able to carve a Jack-o'-lantern and thus prepare for Halloween.
This favorite holiday for children will take place in the botanical garden on October 31st.
🕘 Working schedule: from October 10th to November 2nd, 2025;
📍 Address: Botanical Garden, Trojská 800/196, Prague-7 (view on map). The exhibition will take place in the central part of the garden in the Ornamental Garden exposition.
💰 Cost: admission to the exhibition is done with a standard ticket to the Botanical Garden: 180 kroner - adults, 120 kroner - children (a 15% discount is provided when purchased online).
👉 You can find a detailed program of accompanying events on the garden's website.
